pageContext.claim: “Three years ago, you didn't have brand-new airplanes. You were not doing well. And now you have all brand new. Are you seeing the big difference? ... You know, a little while ago, they were going to the graveyards in the desert and they were taking parts for old planes. You don't have those planes. So you have brand-new, beautiful stock.”
pageContext.analysis: This is greatly exaggerated. The Washington Post reported that similar comments from Trump within days of these remarks “grossly overstate spending decisions and mask an aging fleet of planes.” It takes years to assemble fighter jets and other military aircraft.
